channel.title: A vps
channel.description:
UPDATE NEW QUESTION:
What would I put under "domain" my server website? or my server ip? (no-ip.biz)

item.title: A vps
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

5 seconds of lag to load items? Thats fucked up.

And BTW: If your going to spend money for a VPS, don’t get Windows.
If you’re getting windows because you cant work linux, LOOK HERE FOR HELP

Read full topic

item.title: A vps
item.dc:creator: @Skorge Skorge
item.description:
@Skorge wrote:

[quote=“The_Flames, post:9, topic:311423”][quote author=Skorge link=topic=407859.msg3012516#msg3012516 date=1256918593]

Not necessarily unstable, just more expensive, less powerful, and it leaves you with less system resources for your actual application.

So would I have to have a linux computer to buy a linux vps, or am I just retarded and should stfu -.-
[/quote]

No.

Not necessarily unstable, just more expensive, less powerful, and it leaves you with less system resources for your actual application.

This is what I have to say from my experience, the windows vps used up loads of resources when the server wasn’t even running.

Btw the specs are good, but I bet you’re using a shitty source.[/quote]

Delta based, Ballerzcape

Its pretty good accept there is a 5 secs lag to load items whenever you tele.
Gets annoying overtime.

Read full topic

item.title: A vps
item.dc:creator: @The_Flames The_Flames
item.description:
@The_Flames wrote:

[quote=“Skorge, post:7, topic:311423”][quote author=Unhandled link=topic=407859.msg3012497#msg3012497 date=1256903056]
Not necessarily unstable, just more expensive, less powerful, and it leaves you with less system resources for your actual application.
[/quote]

So would I have to have a linux computer to buy a linux vps, or am I just retarded and should stfu -.-[/quote]

No.

Unhandled:

Not necessarily unstable, just more expensive, less powerful, and it leaves you with less system resources for your actual application.

This is what I have to say from my experience, the windows vps used up loads of resources when the server wasn’t even running.

Btw the specs are good, but I bet you’re using a shitty source.

Read full topic

Is this is a windows vps? If so, fuck you.[/quote]
